result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Miriam E Mclemore

records.addlTxt: Same as complaint
Arraignment on November 15, 2022 at 09:45 am.

(3:12 PM cases 21CM649, 21CM720, 22CF1, 22CF488, 22CF984 called.) All parties and court personnel appear via Zoom. 
Defendant Miriam E Mclemore in court, in custody. Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard appeared by video for Miriam E Mclemore. Prosecuting District Attorney Peter J. Rindal in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Rivard makes record as to why he is appearing via Zoom and that Court granted permission earlier in the day.
Defendant has no objection with Attorney Rivard appearing via video.
Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearings in cases 22CF1, 22CF488, 22CF984 and Court accepts waivers.
Attorney Rivard to schedule an Arraignment in cases 22CF1, 22CF488, 22CF984 and Hearing in cases 21CM649, 21CM720 with Branch 1 Judicial Assistant.

Defendant Miriam E Mclemore in court, in custody with Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard. Attorney Rivard requests a preliminary hearing in felony cases. Other matters are to ride along.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Hearing on October 4, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Prosecuting attorney Angela Lynn Beranek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Ryan Kohler appeared on behalf of the defendant. In 22CF488, 22CF01, 21CM720, 21CM649 warrants have been executed. 
In 22CF984: Defense waives reading of the complaint and time limits for the preliminary hearing. Court orders a $250 cash bond. 
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 9-14-22 at 2:45 PM. 
Return to court: 10-4-22 at 9:30 AM.

Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard appeared by video for Miriam E Mclemore. Attorney Rivard has had no contact with Defendant. Warrant ordered.
